Articles.Content:
It goes out of connection though I'm using active dishes. In Kerbin GeoSync. So, whats the problem?

(note: I am using hyperedit)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-09T15:24:48Z" title="06/09/2015 03:24  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 9, 2015</time> by AlextheBodacious**

a dish on the other side to receive the signal? running out of power at night? space pirate gremlins ate your cables?

I suspect you forgot something like a screenshot of the probe in question
What kind of dishes? what are they aimed at? There's a lot of information that isn't here if you want help.

Yeah, really need to give more info. "Something's wrong, what is it?" isn't terribly specific. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Lots of hings can make a connection not happen:

- Being out of range (of either receiver or transmitter)

- Either the receiver or the transmitter isn't turned on, or is aimed at the wrong target

- No power

- Some planet or moon gets in the way of LOS

- If you're dealing with a multi-link chain of communication, a problem anywhere along the chain can interrupt comm
Or I guess rt\_dump.txt should contain enough information to diagnose the problem

[http://imgur.com/gallery/6E2qY/new](http://imgur.com/gallery/6E2qY/new)

The Radio Towers Are All Active
Dish antenna needs to set target, which from your picture you haven't. It doesn't really matter visually where it points to, just the target it sets to that matters.

The radio tower right next to the KSC is really not needed the KSC has comms with enough range to reach everywhere. 

On your vehicle target Kerbin with at least one antenea with enough range. This will connect with any comsats that are visable or the KSC.

Ensure you have your sats orbiting Kerbin targeting the KSC or targeting a sat with line of site of KSC. They also need to be targeting the active vessel or the planet/moon the vessel is orbiting.

> 
> Dish antenna needs to set target, which from your picture you haven't. It doesn't really matter visually where it points to, just the target it sets to that matters.

You Win.
